p: mRNA-based vaccines can be designed and developed using mRNAs-encoding antigens, to be translated in the human body. This approach was recently launched by Moderna to develop vaccine platforms against SARS-CoV-2 through the use of mRNA-1273, encoding viral S protein [ 64–66]. In May 2020, Moderna received the US FDA clearance to start a Phase II study on lipid nanoparticles (LNP)-encapsulating S protein-encoding mRNA-1273 ( Figure 2) [ 67]. Several studies are currently ongoing in terms of mRNA vaccine development against SARS-CoV-2. Another similar approach involves administration of mRNA encoding an antibody protein.
